abstract: The company told the F.C.C. that Charter’s proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable and Bright House would be “no better for the public interest” than Comcast’s failed deal for Time Warner Cable.
snippet: The company told the F.C.C. that Charter’s proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable and Bright House would be “no better for the public interest” than Comcast’s failed deal for Time Warner Cable.
lead_paragraph: Dish Network, the satellite television provider, has urged regulators to reject a pair of deals proposed by its rival Charter Communications totaling $67.1 billion, saying they would “significantly damage” competition and limit consumer access to online video.

headline.main: Dish Network Seeks Rejection of 2 Deals Proposed by Charter
